item.title: Coordinate Descent Algorithm
item.description: Coordinate Descent Framework At the begining of this section, we start to discuss three different types of function. Given convex, differentiable function \(f: \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}\), we know \(f(x+\delta \cdot e_i)\geq f(x)\) for all \(\delta\) because \(\nabla f(x) = (\frac{\partial f}{\partial x_1}(x),\dots,\frac{\partial f}{\partial x_n}(x)) = 0\). Here, \(e_i = (0,\dots,1,\dots,0) \in \mathbb{R}^n\), the \(i\)th standard basis vactor. Figure1. Convex and differential function \(f\) Given convex but not differentiable function \(f\), we can not found a global minimizer.
